clinical_study.brief_title: A Survey to Evaluate Diabetes Management, Control, Chronic Complications, Psychosocial Aspects of Diabetic Subjects in Bangladesh
clinical_study.official_title: A Cross-Sectional Survey to Evaluate Diabetes Management, Control, Complications, Psychosocial Aspects of Diabetic Patients in Asia and To Evaluate Perceptions and Practices of Physicians and Patients About Diabetes Management in Asia DiabCare Asia 2008 (Bangladesh)

brief_summary.textblock: This study is conducted in Asia. The aim of this observational study is to evaluate current status of diabetes management, control, complications in diabetic subjects in Asia.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean age of onset of type 1 and 2 diabetes mellitus
Mean duration of treatment of type 2 DM
Percentage of patients on Insulin and OAD therapy
Mean duration of diabetes in type 1 and type 2 patients respectively
Mean FPG and PPG of diabetic patients
Percentage of diabetic patients with HbA1c target below or equal to 7.0%.
Percentage of diabetic patients with HbA1c target below or equal to 6.5%.
Percentage of diabetic patients having dyslipidemia and hypertension
Percentage of diabetic patients having cardiovascular complications
Percentage of diabetic patients having peripheral vascular disease
Percentage of diabetic patients having diabetic eye complications
Percentage of diabetic patients having diabetic nephropathy

secondary_outcome.measure: Patients' perception will be analysed through Patient questionnaire measuring:Psychological well-being, Quality of life and Patients' compliant to treatment

Physician perception of diabetes and its management will be analysed through physician questionnaire measuring awareness about HbA1c test and its goal, anti-diabetic treatment and barriers towards optimum diabetes control
Duration of diabetes associated with highest number of diabetic complications
Minimum duration of diabetes associated with 10% incidence of diabetic complications (CVD, nephropathy and retinopathy)

intervention.description: Subject will only fill out a questionaire when entering the observational study.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with diabetes mellitus (both type 1 and type 2) being treated at general hospitals, diabetes clinics and referral clinics will be selected according to inclusion and exclusion criteria. Patients will be selected randomly from clinic record/ list to avoid any bias.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diabetic patients registered in the particular centre for more than 12 months.
- Patients should have visited the centre at least once in the last 3-6 months apart from the initial visit.
- Patients willing to sign informed consent form.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Repetition of any patient as patients should not be included twice for any reason.
- Unwilling to participate or unable to comply with protocol requirements.
